oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Artist In Residence - Earl Scruggs - 2004-09-21 - set 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Third of four Artist in Residence performances by Earl Scruggs from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on September 21, 2004. Set one of two. Special guests include: Gary Scruggs; Randy Scruggs; Jon Randall; Sam Bush; Aubrey Haney; Rob Ickes; Rodney Crowell; Connie Smith; The Whites; Jeff Hanna; Vince Gill; Marty Stuart;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Earl Scruggs; Gary Scruggs; Jon Randall Stewart; Randy Scruggs; Sam Bush; Aubrey Haney; Rodney Crowell; Connie Smith; The Whites; Jeff Hanna; Vince Gill; Marty Stuart; Rob Ickes;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Recording begins in progress during introduction of guests. Salty Dog Blues (Gary Scruggs-vocal) -- Black Mountain Blues (Randy Scruggs-guitar) -- Introductions of special guests -- Charming Betsy (Rodney Crowell-vocal) -- Mr. Bojangles (Jeff Hanna-vocals) -- Key To Life (Vince Gill-vocal) -- Gold Watch And Chain (The Whites) -- The Storms Are On The Ocean (Connie Smith-vocal) -- Molly And Tenbrooks (Sam Bush-vocal) -- Take Me In Your Life Boat (Unidentified vocalist likely Jon Randall) -- Rodney Crowell introduces Marty Stuart -- Pearl, Pearl, Pearl (Marty Stuart-vocal) -- Go Rest High On That Mountain (Vince Gill-vocal) -- Keep On The Sunny Side (The Whites) -- Earl's Breakdown (Earl Scruggs-banjo) -- Intermission.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Scruggs, Earl; Scruggs, Gary; Stewart, Jon Randall; Scruggs, Randy; Bush, Sam; Crowell, Rodney; Smith, Connie; the Whites (Musical group); Hanna, Jeff; Gill, Vince; Haney, Aubrey; Ickes, Rob; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
